## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hi there! I'm interested in learning more about Verus and its features. Can you tell me about what Verus offers for launching and managing currencies, and how it enables integration with other blockchains?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus provides a robust set of features for launching and managing currencies, making it easy to create and manage new tokens without requiring programming knowledge.

Let me walk you through some of the key features. **Launch Features:** When launching a currency on Verus, you can set Kickstarter-like minimums to activate or automatically refund if the minimum is not met. The launch pricing is dynamic and based on participation, offering pre-launch participation price discounts. Additionally, you can specify pre-conversion reserve currency carveouts and price-neutral launch pre-allocations. All of these features can be configured using easy-to-understand commands and parameters.

**Multi-Currency Support:** Currencies on Verus can be launched to accept a range of other currencies, and can be configured with or without fractional reserve capabilities. This allows for flexibility in designing the currency's functionality.

In terms of integration with other blockchains, **Verus's import/export protocol** is designed to make integration with other blockchains provable and easy. This enables the creation of bridges between Verus and other blockchain networks, such as ETH/ERC20 tokens. These bridges allow for automatic send/receive of any Verus network token between Verus and other blockchain networks. For example, a currency can be sent between Verus and ETH, where it will be expressed as a Verus currency on the Verus network and automatically exposed on ETH as an ERC20 token.

Lastly, **Merge Mining and Multi-Chain Technology:** Verus is also developing merge mining and multi-chain technology, which will enable Verus network chains to operate fully independently while still being dynamically merge mineable along with up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash. This means that all network blockchains will provide the same fractional currency capabilities, both for on-chain tokens and native zk-SNARK supporting currencies.

What features does Verus offer for launching and managing currencies, and how does it enable integration with other blockchains?

Verus provides a robust set of features for launching and managing currencies, making it easy to create and manage new tokens without requiring programming knowledge. 

**Launch Features:**
When launching a currency on Verus, you can set Kickstarter-like minimums to activate or automatically refund if the minimum is not met. The launch pricing is dynamic and based on participation, offering pre-launch participation price discounts. Additionally, you can specify pre-conversion reserve currency carveouts and price-neutral launch pre-allocations. All of these features can be configured using easy-to-understand commands and parameters.

**Multi-Currency Support:**
Currencies on Verus can be launched to accept a range of other currencies, and can be configured with or without fractional reserve capabilities. This allows for flexibility in designing the currency's functionality.

**Integration with Other Blockchains:**
Verus's import/export protocol is designed to make integration with other blockchains provable and easy. This enables the creation of bridges between Verus and other blockchain networks, such as ETH/ERC20 tokens. These bridges allow for automatic send/receive of any Verus network token between Verus and other blockchain networks. For example, a currency can be sent between Verus and ETH, where it will be expressed as a Verus currency on the Verus network and automatically exposed on ETH as an ERC20 token.

**Merge Mining and Multi-Chain Technology:**
Verus is also developing merge mining and multi-chain technology, which will enable Verus network chains to operate fully independently while still being dynamically merge mineable along with up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash. This means that all network blockchains will provide the same fractional currency capabilities, both for on-chain tokens and native zk-SNARK supporting currencies.

# The Best Way to Launch a Currency
Currency launches with Kickstarter-like minimums to activate or, if not met, automatically refund, dynamic currency launch pricing, based on participation, pre-launch participation price discounts, pre-conversion reserve currency carveouts, and price-neutral launch pre-allocations, all specified in easy to understand commands and parameters, no programming necessary!Currencies can be launched to accept a range of other currencies and with or without fractional reserve capabilities. Verus import/export protocol was designed to make integration with other block chains provable and easy, and there are already external bridges in progress that expect to enable automatic send/receive of any Verus network token between Verus and ETH/ERC20 tokens, where currencies can be sent between Verus and ETH, expressed as Verus currencies on the Verus network, and exposed automatically on ETH as an ERC20 token.# Preparing for Multi-chain, Dynamic Merge Mining
While this 0.7.1 testnet enables on-chain token currency definition, the same advances will soon be available on the Verus merge mining and multi-chain technology which was running on testnet last year. When enabled, this will make it possible for Verus network chains to operate fully independently, yet be dynamically merge mineable along with Verus and up to 20 other Verus network blockchains on a single hash, earning rewards and powering all chains simultaneously. All network blockchains will provide the same fractional currency capabilities, both for on-chain tokens as well as native zk-SNARK supporting currencies as well.## Sending and Converting Currency
